item.title: Beogram 4000: Hood Restoration - Polishing and Exchange of the Hinge
item.description:
My recent Beogram 4000 restoration project required a hood restoration. I had two hoods: one had a cracked corner, and the other had a good plexiglass body but a corroded hinge. Corrosion is common on Beogram 4000 hinges. It’s fixable with sanding and repainting, but finding a good hinge is preferable. Luckily, the cracked hood had a usable hinge, so I decided to swap them. Removing the hinge requires care to avoid damaging the aluminum strip on the back of the hood...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Installation of New Aluminum Pulley for the Carriage Servo
item.description:
Recently, I completed the restoration of a Beogram 4002 (5501) turntable. The final piece I needed was a new aluminum pulley for the carriage servo. The original pulley was cracked and causing unwanted noise and vibration, particularly during rapid carriage movements like starting and stopping. This was not acceptable for a quality turntable. A standard replacement pulley wasn’t compatible with this early 5501 model. These early models use a unique end groove detection system requiring a pulley with four holes that function as an optical chopper to monitor the carriage speed...
